text:
While backporting changes to fix caching issue I found several others
enhancenments or fixes in util_ldap_*.  All which seamed reasonable to me and
which don't change exported API are included.
creator: ondrej@sury.org

Miscelaneous fixes for mod_ldap

ondrej@sury.org
text:
Description of changes:
- added AP_NEED_SET_MUTEX_PERMS parts
- SHM memory size is now aligned
- alg_create_cache now takes cache_size as second argument
- cache create now uses correct values thanks to ^
- hashval changed to unsigned long from int
- and same other smaller fixes

Created attachment 16431
Miscelaneous fixes for mod_ldap (without .orig files)
creator: ondrej@sury.org
jorton@redhat.com
text:
Thanks.  All the serious mod_ldap fixes (a subset of the patch you attached) are
already in the 2.0.x branch for 2.0.55; anything additional needs to be
submitted individually to dev@httpd and receive votes for backport, bugzilla
isn't really the right place to do that.

Thanks for info.  I will test 2.0.x version in production and see if it crashes
or not.

Maybe the crashes I see when caches are on are just related to
http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=36563

I will investigate this issue more and report it back to dev list.
creator: ondrej@sury.org
wrowe@apache.org
text:
Ondraj...

if you would like to see specific bits and pieces backported, it is much better
to submit 2.0.x-only changes, and 2.2.x backports to the dev@httpd list.  Please
make each patch address a single issue with some good information (original
svn commit, bug report number, original commit log message) so it's easily
digested and approved by as many of our devs as possible.  If your patch takes
more than 15 minutes to understand, it is much less likely to be approved.

No problem.  I tested 2.0.x today with caching bits fixed (see my mail to
dev@httpd from today) and it works flawlessly (no Segfaults at all).

Ondrej.
creator: ondrej@sury.org
